Course Description: GIVES FUNDAMENTAL DRILL IN THE PRINCIPLES OF ACCOUNTING THROUGH THE MEDIUM OF QUESTIONS, EXERCISES, AND PROBLEMS, REDUCING ROUTINE AND DETAIL WORK TO MINIMUM. INCLUDES A STUDY OF THE ACCOUNTING STATEMENT, ITS FORMS AND CONSTRUCTION, ANALYSIS OF BUSINESS TRANSACTIONS, RECORDING OF THE SAME IN JOURNALS, THE LEDGERS, ADJUSTING ENTRIES, CLOSING ENTRIES, REVERSING ENTRIES, WORK SHEETS. ALSO INCLUDES STUDY OF INVENTORY VALUATING DEPRECIATION, ACCRUALS AND DEFERRALS, PAPYROLL AND OTHER RELATED TOPICS.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
